answers.answer: Awesome! Do you feel better overall? With the help of the naturopathic doc at my MS practice I lost 40 pounds and feel MUCH better!Our bodies are at war, albeit with themselves, and everything we can do to help it is important.Great job!Kyle

Woo hoo!Excellent progress  good news-news haha!Oftentimes doctors tell patients to "go on a diet" lose some weight or gain soem weight. And not, please see a dietician.I feel everyone who needs weight control should seek a dietician. I do not know what I would have done w/out one years back w/gestational diabetes during my child bearing years. What I learned was priceless, and to this day, I know how to balance foods to maintain sugar and weight.Happy for you!!!!-Shell

Great on the weight loss. When I had Chemo they told me to gain weight but no one told me how. Finally they sent me to a dietitian. I learned so much from her. She got out her calculator and told me I need 2800 Calories a day which was really hard for me. Then she came up with six things I could have prepared in advance and keep in the fridge so they were easy. I had to eat six times a day. Little meals. Friends prepared these little meals. I am so grateful to her and my friends. I had quit eating all together at that point.I am back to not wanting to eat but I am doing what she said and eating like taking medicine.Alex

question: Went to Neuro today.  She is THRILLED that I saw a dietitian and have started to lose weight.  She is big on weight control and truly feels you need a cane/walker sooner than later with MS.I dont think this is "new news", just FYI.  Her NP showed me this today and just passing it on.  This is my neuro.  Think I need to move out of OH?!Michellehttp://www.wkyc.com/news/story.aspx?storyid=279312
title: Well, looks like the 17 pounds I lost might be the start of something good?
